title: Someone who study Theology, how is it to study Theology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Typically, a person preparing for a life in the priesthood or ministry will attend a school called a seminary. Of course, different religions have different “theologies”.  Each  of the world’s  religions  has its own  Theologians who engage in  scholarship.  There are also religious writings  and teaches which have very little scholarship for that basis. However, you and I as individuals can study theology, merely by reading books on the subject of studies concerning God and religion and religious teachings and doctrines. It can involve the study of a scripture in the context of morality, typology, analogy, and literal understanding. It can involve the study of ancient scriptures. It can involve the study of moral commandments. It can involve studies in the arguments for the existence of God. It can involve the study of basic doctrines and also involve a study of doctrinal differences between various religions denominations and sects. It can involve historiography, which is the historical reliability of doctrines and teachings and religious texts. It can involve archaeology and also research into ancient languages. It can mean reading books like the following: “Jesus, Qumran, and the Vatican” by Otto Betz and Rainer Riesner ISBN-10: 033402109X or “The Historical Reliability of the Gospels” by Craig L. Blomberg ISBN-10: 9780830828074 . . And it can also include researches that involve study of the writings by Gottfried Wilhelm (von) Leibniz 1646 - 1716) German philosopher .

I have studied theology—study of God. Usually, theological schools present “Systematic Theology.” Systematic Theology is an arrangement or organization of theology into its separate subjects: God, Man, Sin, Atonement, Eschatology (future events), etc. Christian theology is supposed to be based upon “revelation,” the Bible. However, church tradition greatly effects theological concepts in some groups, such as Roman Catholics. It’s better to be familiar with the Bible before you study theology at the graduate level (Seminary). Bible colleges present theology on an undergraduate level. An accredited Bible college is a good place to start a formal study of theology. Nevertheless, you can do it on your own, but like anything else . . .teachers make things easier (sometimes).
